front.title: BGP based Multi-homing in Virtual Private LAN Service

abstract.t: Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) is a Layer 2 Virtual PrivateNetwork (VPN) that gives its customers the appearance that theirsites are connected via a Local Area Network (LAN). It is oftenrequired for the Service Provider (SP) to give the customer redundantconnectivity to some sites, often called "multi-homing". This memoshows how BGP-based multi-homing can be offered in the context of LDPand BGP VPLS solutions.
